body.p: Born near Louisville, Kentucky. Graduated from the law department at Harvard University in 1838. Began practicing law in Louisville in 1840, associated with Hon. William J. Graves. Served as Lieutenant-Colonel of the 4th Regiment of Kentucky Volunteer Infantry during the Mexican American War, under the command of General William O. Butler. Returned to Louisville in 1849, where he was elected a member of Kentucky's constitutional convention. Elected to represent the city of Louisville in the Kentucky Legislature in 1850. Elected to the Kentucky state senate in 1851. Elected to Congress in 1852, re-elected in 1853. During the Civil War, joined General Albert Sidney Johnston at Bowling Green and served on his staff as colonel until the Battle of Shiloh, where Gen. Johnston died in his arms. Promoted to brigadier-general soon after. Appointed Confederate States Minister to Mexico in 1863. Joined E. Kirby Smith in Texas soon after, and was promoted major-general. He was also a brother-in-law of General Albert Sidney Johnson. (Preston's sister married Johnson).
